菎菎菎

菎字的基本解释

菎
kūn
古书上说的一种香草。
古通“琨”。

菎字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kūn］
［《廣韻》古渾切，平魂，見。］
(1)通“琨”。玉石。参见“菎蕗”。
(2)见“菎蕗”。

菎字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　菎； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1037第18
【唐韻】古渾切，音昆。香草也。【楚辭·招魂】菎蔽象棋。【註】菎玉或言菎蕗，今之箭囊也。【東方朔·七諫】菎蕗雜乎叢蒸。　又【集韻】古本切，音袞。草名。【博雅】菎，?也。　【說文】作?。【類篇】一作?。

菎字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
菎字的起名意思

同“琨”，指美玉，也指古书上说的一种香草。

Si
Basic explanation of words
Si
kūn
A kind of vanilla mentioned in ancient books.
Gu Tong "kun".
Si
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［kūn］
["Guangyun" Gu Hun cut, Ping Hun, see. ]
(1) Through "Kun". jade. See "Issue".
(2) See "Sweet Lotus".
Si
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Jian Zi] 　菎; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 1037 Page 18
[Tang Yun] Ancient Hun cut, Yin Kun. Vanilla too. [Songs of the Chu·Soul Recalling] Shuzhang Chess. [Note] Idodendron jade or Yanduan, today's quiver is also. 【Dongfangshuo·Seven Admonishments】Issue is mixed and steamed.　[Jiyun] Ancient version cut, sound tang. Cursive name. [Bo Ya] You,? Yeah.　[Said the text] for?. 【Classes】A work?.

Name meaning
Same as "kun", it refers to beautiful jade and also refers to a kind of vanilla mentioned in ancient books.
kūn
beautiful jade; bamboo
